page.title: 02FISHING IN NORTH SHIELDS
page.content: {Fishing}has been an important { {industry}in{North Shields}for hundreds of years. It was made an important trade as long ago as 1225 when the Prior of Tynemouth had "sheels" or fishermen's huts to be erected where the Pow Burn ran into the River Tyne. This was how North Shields first got ots name and where the present Fish Quay came to be built. Employing a large number of people in fishing itself and the many associated industries, the Fish Quay has declined in importance recently because of the many new regulations concerning the catching of fish in the North Sea, and the reduction in the number of fishing boats using the Quay.
